name: Luxury Bahia Principe Esmeralda Don Pablo Collection

reviews.text: The hotel is only a part of the Grand Bahia Principe complex, and shares many parts and services with the Punta Cana, Bavaro and Ambar hotels, even if some items are exclusive. As a result of that, beach is too crowded, and same happens with self service food facilities and others. A la carte menus (exception to be made at the Garden Grill, excellent meat and fish) are below average, and water sports are in some cases difficult to do, being fully booked from the day before.
reviews.title: too big

reviews.text: The beach is fine, an extended line of white sand, but again too crowded to walk, to stay or to swim (due to the huge number of guests of the main complex who share the beach). The sea is, in my view, a little too brave, not a lagoon or similar like some other places in Punta Cana.
reviews.title: August in Punta Cana

reviews.text: The golf course (Punta Blanca) is ok, a nice and funny 18 holes course reasonably well maintained, even if not in pristine conditions. Very convenient, only 2 minutes away and with a very easy shuttle from the hotel. The cost is 100 USD per person, but it includes boogie and lunch. We purchased a voucher for a 7 days reservation for 550 USD per person, a significant savings.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs at Esmeralda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are big and generous, with a couple of king size beds and room service staff is friendly and effective. Beverages in the freezer are included.
reviews.title: Bahua was amazing

reviews.text: I would reccomend to those travelling without children to choose the Ambar Hotel, or alternatively, to go to Esmeralda but spend the day at the Ambar beach and pool areas, much quieter and less crowded.
reviews.title: Still My Favourite!

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Dominican republic and it did not disappoint, the hotel, the food, the location, the cleanliness all first class. The pool was brilliant and being so close to the beach kept everyone in the family happy. We would definitely come back to the Esmeralda, it had absolutely everything anyone would need.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: This was 1 of the best family vacations in awhile. The service was excellent starting with Jose at the Buffet restaurant. Room service with Felix Lebron is to die for. This gentleman was excellent throughout my stay there.The Esmaralda was in a perfect location from the beach to all the restaurants.
reviews.title: Amazing family vacation

reviews.text: I visited the Esmaralda during the first two weeks of August, with my sister and cousin, and can truly say We had a fantastic two week vacation.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation
Information about Hotel, Please!
reviews.text: Butler Service - Our Butler was Yuleyda - she was amazing. On meeting she introduced herself and was extremely polite and friendly. Yuleyda was exceptional throughout my entire stay, she surprised me with scented pillows (lavender and mango), and a bubble bath with candles and red roses, which was a welcome surprise after a long day in the sun. If anything was required such as extra pillows, ice or other enquiries about where to find various places or items on the complex, Yuleyda was there to help with no hesitation. Even bring them directly to the room. I would recommend her services to anyone and you would not be disappointed. Thanks to her Manager Ramon Diaz for appointing her to me.

The hotel room - The room was amazing, very spacious with two large four poster beds. It was kept exceptionally clean by housekeeping and if I required any extras such as shower caps or gel this would be provided very quickly.
reviews.title: Honeymoon - Perfect

reviews.text: I went during the week of march break. It was just me and my mother and we had a fabulous time.
reviews.title: Amazing time during march break! Will go back with whole family next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: The rooms were very clean and were decorated daily with rose petals and artwork with the towels. Every night when we came back from dinner and the shows the towels were changed and there were chocolates waiting by our bed...on the first night we were treated to a large fruit platter with fresh fruits andon the last day we had a lit bubble bath waiting for us. The food was very good and I would recommend the steakhouse and the japanese(at the punta can complex, but you can just take a trolley) the buffet also had a different theme every night which was also good. The pool was always clean and the pool bars were very clean. The shows at night were also very good including the circus and micheal Jackson show.
reviews.title: Quality in Everything

reviews.text: CONS: Some of the staff weren't that friendly and it felt like you were bothering them when you were asking them something. When you go to the shops-the plaza at the punta Cana complex DO NOT walk through the kiosk!! I repeat DO NOT walk through- walk around!! They will haras you and make you buy something when you can find it cheaper in one of the stores around the kiosks. But when you walk around the still haras you and try to make you come over, "lady, lady, come here" was some of the words that they said to you. Either ignore the or tell them you already bought something, or your going to be late for a reservation and they will still ask for you. Trust me! When it comes forge room keys, do not put them near technology- your cellphone, computer, mp3, iPod because it will make your room key not work and you will be locked out! Learned from experience...
reviews.title: Great relaxing March break

reviews.text: Overall it was an amazing trip and will go back with my whole family next time :D
reviews.title: Nothing wrong but there are much nicer places in Punta Cana

reviews.text: It is hard to please me when it comes to travel. My problem is that I was rich once and waisted a lot of money on luxury hotels and Michelin stars restaurants. And if you read my reviews, you can see how dissatisfied I am with most of the places that I travel on the "limited" budget.
reviews.title: Great Rooms

reviews.text: 1-The check-in staff was polite. 2-The resort felt safe. 3-The resort was very clean. 4-The room was clean. 5-The furniture was in good condition. 6-The bed was comfortable. 7-The temperature was not appropriate, in the middle of the night, they turned down the air conditioner, it was very hot. 8-The restaurant very was clean. 9-Not much menu variety. 10-The quality of the beverage wasn't good (pina colada). 11-The quality of the service wasn't good especially at the buffet restaurant next to the reception(watch out for dirty glasses, spoon, dishes, more) and the adult jacuzzis( they never show up to take the drinks order). 12.-The transportation at night is very slow. 13.-They never had reservation for the good restaurants.
reviews.title: TOO BIG

reviews.text: My family and I, 2 adults and children ages 9 and 7 stayed at the Bahia Principe Esmeralda for 7 days in June. I am writing this review as I rely on tripadvisor before I book a trip and want to extend my experience. This resort was rated number #6 in Punta Cana when i booked and this influenced my decision.
reviews.title: Anyone with a peanut allergy, stay away!

reviews.text: I read nothing about anyone complaining about peanuts......as a parent of a child who had this allergy this resort is a nightmare. Both pool bars in the Esmeralda section offer peanuts to their guests. It totally stressed me out....people were even eating them in the pool out of little plastic cups. I am writing this review to warm other parents who are travelling with children who suffer from a peanut allergy......stay away from this resort. Overall, it was just average in service, nobody went out of their way. There were no fresh beach towels for 2 days...had to use the same. Service was very inconsistent. If you haven't booked any restaurants there is no way you will get a table while you are there, we were stuck eating at the buffet for the 7 days. There was a lot of choice at the buffet restaurants but everything was overcooked. I mean everything...even the poached eggs were hard as rocks. All the meat dishes were dry.....we only really enjoyed the mangoes!! The entertainment was boring and not much for children . We still had a great time and we enjoyed the beach and family time. But i would never go back to this resort because there was no WOW effect when we left. Hope this helps others make their travel plans.
reviews.title: bell boy Nelson

reviews.text: I would like to share with you that the bell boy Nelson is an expert in hospitality. He was approachable and always smiled and gave great eye contact.
reviews.title: Most amazing holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there for one week and every time I saw him he was being pleasant with all the of the guests.
reviews.title: Great two weeks:)

reviews.text: Great trip however.... You need at least 7 days to enjoy all the beauty this complex has to offer. It takes a couple days to find your way around and get a system down on getting from point A to point B as this is a HUGE resort as so many have stated. The downfall is...huge resort = VERY crowded beach. If (close) people watching is your thing go for it. If you want space to relax and enjoy the beach choose elsewhere. Pristine rooms and grounds, food just so so. You will not go hungry but from what I have seen Principe Resorts put more emphasis on beautiful restaurants than food quality. The staff is very accommodating. All room requests were met upon arrival. They also went above and beyond when they found out it was my husbands Birthday Celebration. Alot of special added details by staff. All in all it was a beautiful trip. Yes, I would recommend it but for me...my heart belongs to Iberostar Resorts!
reviews.title: Not Long Enough at Esmeralda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Esmeralda for two weeks from 5th. March. We had read all the reviews and thought we had really hit on a winning resort. However the start was not great, we arrived from the airport at about 8;00PM from Madrid. About 25 people got off the bus at the Premier Lobby, the tour operator rep. vanished as did 23 of the guests onto buggies to their rooms, we were the only Esmeralda guests and the Bell boys said "wait". We waited half an hour no one came so we had to ask the Premier reception to contact Esmeralda and eventually we were picked up, not good after a nine hour flight!
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Facilitites and Surroundings, Service mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had emailed the resort requesting a high floor in Villa 90 if possible, and also given dates for A La Carte restaurants which had good reviews, for the holiday period. We ended up on a mid floor in 92 facing the back road. The next day when we checked with Customer Services they were unable to confirm any of the restaurant bookings I had requested, so we started again from scratch, not good.
reviews.title: A little on the fence....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the room location the junior suite room was excellent, spacious well furnished and clean, and it was beautifully set up for us on arrival.The maid service was very good thoughout our stay, helped with a few US$ tips.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: The Jasmin buffet restaurant was impressive and the food offered was varied and of good quality throughout. However someone needs to explain to the serving staff how to carve the meat joints, chicken and turkey on offer. These are all hacked to pieces,sometimes with only spoons to rip off the side of a chicken. Requesting, in spanish, to cut slices with a knife, hardly helped at all. Our first Gala night was a disaster, arriving at the restaurant at 7:30 we had to queue outside for 15 minutes and when we eventually got a table the place was like a scrum with people fighting to get served with the lobster,prawns etc which by the time we had eaten our starters, had virtually run out. The second week the management issued tickets with a reservation time on them with only a 5 minute time slot, and this did improve the situation.
reviews.title: nice family vacation

reviews.text: Delicious food. Fabulous presentation and great taste. Staff working in the restaurants is very friendly and lovely towards children. The only thing I can think of which could be better is the themes of the dinners. Mexican evening f.i. means that some of the food is Mexican, but the entourage is always the same and not Mexican at all. Everything is very clean. The pool, the rooms, the restaurants, etc. It is quiet, no loud people drinking absurd amounts of alcohol and absurd loud music, as in most of the hotels in Punta Cana. The only thing missing is live music - a band - in the evening in the lobby bar. A key board player is there some nights, but is not very entertaining in my opinion. And last, I would like to mention that my son -two years old - lost his teddy bear, a brown dog. Every day I asked at the guest services. No one brought in such kind of dog. But maybe you were there as well, and you found it! Please let me know. I am willing to pay for transportation! We were in Esmeralda from 1 till 16 March. And we lost it on March 2 near to and outside the main lobby of Bahia Principe Punta Cana.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay! Far out the best hotel at this moment in Punta Cana.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful place. It was immaculately clean and the grounds were beautifully maintained. The buffet food was delicious, plentiful and quickly replaced. The staff were friendly and quick to respond. My one complaint was the state of the gym. With the number of people who like to work out on vacation, more money could be spent to upgrade and improve the quality and amount of equipment.
reviews.title: Fun Times

reviews.text: The Esmeralda section of the complex is located next to the beach and has it's own pool, three retaurants and lobby. The buffets were comparable to any "Caribbean" 5-star resort. The a la Cartes were exeptional, and we drank restaurant water all week with no complaints. The service was exceptional everywhere, kind, prompt, very upbeat and personal. Augusto was funny and helpful to all his dinner guests, a special man with young children. Manolo kept his pool bar patrons laughing and dancing to his favourite merengue songs. These are the tyes of people that make vacations memorable and personal...Muchas Gracias a todo!
reviews.title: Grand, picturesque, comfortable and friendly...but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not so good: I succumbed to the pressure to attend a Privilege Club seminar with my family. We told them during the high-pressure spiel that it wouldn't work for us but they persisted for two hours to try to sell us 30 year/30 week packages, with 1/2 the amount up front. I probably won't be around for 30 more years! When we finnally convinced them that we weren't going to buy, Michael, our salesman went from "buddy" to "used car salesman" immediately, inferring that we wasted his time. When in, fact, the opposite was true. But since I agreed to attend...I will take responsibility for my loss of beach time. No other issues...just watch that sun...reapply sunscreen often! Try a little Spanish with the staff....they will love you for it
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.text: We had an amazing week at the Esmerelda! The facilities were so clean and well kept. The service was great. The beaches were amazing and great to walk on. I highly recommend building 90, we were so close to the pool and beach, but the Esmerelda is fairly small so nothing is too far!
reviews.title: Family trip

reviews.text: We stayed the week of Aug 16 -23 and I miss it already!!! I want to start of by saying the PEPOLE are wonderful and kind and friendly !! Ok so let me start off by saying Victor are butler made are trip the best!! he is a hard worker and and did so many wonderful things for my family . like doing a bubble bath with flowers and a chilled bottle waiting for my husband and myself in are room thank you so much for that ! Xoxox It was my husbands birthday that day! Also scented pillows all week along victor went out of his way to make my family happy !!!! ❤❤❤❤Then there was Jose Cedeno he was also so helpful he got all are dinners times and dates for us as well there was Ramon who made my family feel like we were at home .... The hotel was like paradise everything was always clean from out side to the room oh yes thank you to are maid who always had it stocked with extra towels and bottle water and even chips for my daughter . The food was out of this world for sure a 5 star Thank you to the hard working kind PEPOLE from Esmeralda see you next year for sure we miss punta cana already !! From Kevin and giusepina Mitchell
reviews.title: The best vacation ! Fantastic hotel and PEPOLE
We all got some kind of sick

reviews.text: My hubby and I took a trip to punta Cana three years ago on a babymoon with our twins- this summer, we went back with our older kids to give them and us a break from the babies and devote some time to just them. It started out really well, the flight to, airport and bus to hotel was great. Check in was lovely, greeted with cool juice and the hotel lobby and environment was just as it seemed when we visited a different hotel as just adults last time. I confidently told the other travelers I was with as they asked, "will the water and food be ok?" "Yes! Of course! Hotels are always the best, they simply can't afford to get a reputation for anything else. They have their own filtration systems, last time I visited I was pregnant, granted, at a different hotel, but all was good!" Wow! Who knew how wrong I could be. Hubby and I have traveled a lot, this is generally the rule, stay off the streets and stick to the hotels and you'll generally avoid any sort of "bug". Of our group of 15 though, I'd say about 7 of us got something- one end or the other. Standing there in disbelief as my 7 year old was vomiting in the night- I really wanted to go home.
reviews.title: Top draw all round

reviews.text: The reviewer below nails it-
reviews.title: Beach/pools = Good, the rest isn't good.

reviews.text: The beds are so firm you could choose the marble or bed and probably not know the difference.
reviews.title: Do not stay at this hotel under any circumstances - not even a free trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there from 13 to 20 March 2012.
reviews.title: Luxurious Family Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Lovely All Inclusive in Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is extremely beautiful. The buildings were built just a few years ago so it is all very new and very modern.
reviews.title: Good Service, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and service were very good.
reviews.title: overall good

reviews.text: The resort is extremely clean.
reviews.title: Second time here as great as the first!
